intro: Borreria poaya var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to parts of Central and South America, this species thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or rocky hillsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm regions.
